p: MPV is associated with both upper and lower respiratory tract disease [ 182, 280– 282]. Rhinorrhea and cough are the most frequent symptoms, while hoarseness, laryngitis, sore throat, and croup are less common [ 238– 241, 243, 282]. A large prospective study of children with URI detected MPV in 5 % of patients, similar to RSV, influenza, and PIV but less frequent than adenovirus and rhinovirus. In these children with URI associated with MPV, fever was present in 54 %, coryza in 82 %, cough in 66 %, pharyngitis in 44 %, hoarseness in 8 %, and conjunctivitis in 3 % [ 280]. MPV is associated with acute otitis media and has been detected in nasal secretions and middle ear fluid [ 182, 280, 283– 285].
